intro: Cyphostemma pseudorhodesiae, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or wooded areas. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
